snippet: The abductions appeared to be the work of insurgents from nearby islands of the southern Philippines who have been fighting the Philippine government.
abstract: Gunmen kidnap Chinese tourist and Filipino hotel worker, both women, from Singamata Reef Resort off coast of Malaysian Borneo, spurring an international manhunt; abductions appear to be work of insurgents from nearby islands of southern Philippines who have been fighting the Philippine government for years; kidnapping risks complicating ties between China and Malaysia, already strained over the disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370.

byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and FLOYD WHALEY
byline.contributor: Kirk Semple reported from Kuala Lumpur, and Floyd Whaley from Manila. Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Bree Feng and Mia Li contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The abductions appeared to be the work of insurgents from nearby islands of the southern Philippines who have been fighting the Philippine government.

headline.main: 2 Women Are Kidnapped From a Resort in Malaysia
headline.print_headline: 2 Women Are Kidnapped From a Resort in Malaysia
